definitions: having qualities traditionally associated with men such as strength and assertiveness
relating to or characteristic of men or boys
denoting a gender of nouns and adjectives in certain languages
examples: His deep voice and broad shoulders gave him a masculine appearance
The cologne had a strong, masculine scent of cedar and leather
The barbershop specialized in masculine grooming and traditional shaving
He preferred masculine activities like football and weightlifting
In Spanish, 'el' is the masculine article used before nouns
The word 'actor' is masculine while 'actress' is feminine

definitions: having the face covered with a mask or covering for protection or concealment
concealed, disguised, or kept hidden from view or understanding
examples: The masked robber entered the bank just before closing time
All medical staff must remain masked during surgical procedures
Her cheerful demeanor masked deep feelings of grief and loss
The true costs were masked by creative accounting practices

definitions: relating to or denoting Freemasons or Freemasonry, a fraternal organization with secret ceremonies and rituals
examples: The old building housed a masonic lodge for over a century
He wore a masonic ring bearing the square and compass symbol

definitions: equipped with one or more masts, especially describing ships or sailing vessels by their number of masts
examples: The three-masted schooner sailed gracefully across the harbor
They spotted a tall-masted ship on the horizon at sunset

definitions: having complete knowledge or skill in a subject, technique, or accomplishment through study or practice
having undergone the final production process in audio or video recording to create the finished product
examples: She had mastered five languages by the age of thirty
The chef's mastered techniques showed in every perfectly plated dish
The mastered album sounded crisp and balanced on all speakers
They released both the raw and mastered versions of the track

definitions: performed or performing with impressive skill, knowledge, and confidence that demonstrates complete command
having or showing a domineering, authoritative, or imperious manner in dealing with others
examples: The pianist gave a masterful performance of Chopin's most difficult Ã©tudes
Her masterful handling of the crisis saved the company from bankruptcy
His masterful tone brooked no disagreement from the subordinates
She took a masterful approach to managing the unruly committee

definitions: showing the skill or knowledge of a master in a particular art, craft, or field of expertise
examples: The surgeon performed the delicate operation with masterly precision
His masterly analysis of the poem revealed layers of hidden meaning

definitions: having a dull or flat surface without shine, gloss, or luster
examples: She preferred mat lipstick over glossy formulas for daily wear
The photographer chose mat paper for a more artistic print finish

definitions: corresponding in pattern, color, design, or other qualities to form a harmonious pair or set
having equal or similar ability, strength, or resources making competition balanced and fair
examples: She wore perfectly matched pearl earrings with her necklace
The matched set of luggage made traveling more organized
The two chess players were evenly matched in skill and experience
The matched teams produced an exciting game that went to overtime

definitions: having the same pattern, color, style, or other features so as to correspond or harmonize with something else
examples: The bridesmaids wore matching dresses in soft lavender
He bought matching curtains and pillows for the living room

definitions: having no equal or match in quality, skill, or excellence; incomparable and unrivaled
examples: Her matchless beauty captivated everyone who met her at the gala
The athlete's matchless speed left competitors far behind on the track

definitions: paired or coupled for breeding purposes, especially referring to animals during reproductive behavior
joined, matched, or fitted together as complementary parts or partners
examples: The mated birds built their nest high in the oak tree
The zoo's mated pandas were closely monitored during breeding season
The perfectly mated gears operated smoothly without any grinding noise
The mated pieces of the puzzle formed a complete picture

definitions: excessively concerned with material possessions, wealth, and physical comfort rather than spiritual or intellectual values
examples: Her materialistic lifestyle focused on designer clothes and luxury cars
The materialistic culture promoted consumption over personal relationships

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a mother, especially in being caring, protective, and nurturing
related through the mother's side of the family rather than the father's
examples: Her maternal instincts kicked in when she heard the baby crying
The teacher showed maternal concern for her struggling students
He inherited his artistic talent from his maternal grandmother
The maternal lineage could be traced back five generations

definitions: relating to or involving mathematics, its principles, methods, or applications in various fields
characterized by or using the rigor, precision, and logical reasoning typical of mathematics
examples: The students struggled with complex mathematical equations in calculus class
Her mathematical abilities earned her a scholarship to engineering school
The detective approached the case with mathematical precision and logic
The choreography required mathematical timing between all the dancers

definitions: relating to a social system in which the mother or oldest female is head of the family and descent is traced through the female line
examples: The matriarchal society placed elder women in positions of leadership
Their matriarchal family structure meant property passed from mother to daughter

definitions: based on or tracing descent through the maternal line, with inheritance and kinship determined through mothers
examples: In their matrilineal culture, children belonged to their mother's clan
The matrilineal inheritance system ensured property stayed with female descendants

definitions: relating to marriage or the relationship between married people, including legal and social aspects
examples: They hired a lawyer specializing in matrimonial law for their divorce
The matrimonial ceremony included traditions from both families' cultures

definitions: having a dull finish without shine or gloss, not reflecting light
examples: The walls were painted in matt black for a modern look
She chose matt tiles for the bathroom to prevent slipping

definitions: having a flat, non-reflective surface that lacks shine, gloss, or sheen
examples: The matte finish on the laptop prevented annoying screen glare
She preferred matte nail polish for a sophisticated, understated look

definitions: tangled in a thick mass, especially describing hair or fur knotted together
covered with or resting on mats or mat-like material
examples: The stray dog's matted fur needed careful grooming and trimming
Her hair became matted after swimming in the salty ocean water
The gym floor was matted for safety during wrestling practice
They found the animals on matted straw in the barn

definitions: fully developed physically or mentally, having reached the most advanced stage of growth
showing emotional and mental development characteristic of an adult, with good judgment
ready for use or consumption after proper aging, ripening, or development time
examples: The mature oak trees provided shade for the entire park
Mature students often bring valuable life experience to university classes
Her mature response to criticism impressed the interview panel
He showed mature judgment in handling the difficult situation
The mature cheese had developed a rich, complex flavor profile
These bonds will reach mature value in ten years

definitions: having undergone aging or development to reach optimal quality, flavor, or readiness
having developed fully into adulthood with corresponding physical and mental characteristics
examples: The matured whiskey had spent twelve years aging in oak barrels
Their matured investment strategy yielded substantial returns over time
She had matured into a confident and capable professional
His matured perspective came from years of varied life experiences

definitions: self-pityingly or tearfully sentimental, often through being drunk or excessively emotional about past events
examples: After several drinks, he became maudlin about his failed marriage
The movie's maudlin ending tried too hard to make viewers cry

definitions: of a pale purple color similar to mallow flowers, between pink and violet
examples: She decorated the nursery in soft mauve and cream tones
The mauve sunset reflected beautifully on the calm lake surface

definitions: characterized by independence of thought and action, refusing to follow conventional rules or practices
examples: His maverick approach to business disrupted the entire industry
The maverick scientist challenged established theories with her research

definitions: of the greatest or longest length, especially describing clothing that reaches to the ankles
examples: She wore a flowing maxi dress to the beach wedding
The maxi coat kept her warm during the harsh winter

definitions: being or relating to a maximum; constituting the greatest or highest possible amount, degree, or intensity
examples: The athletes trained for maximal performance during the Olympic games
The treatment protocol aims for maximal therapeutic benefit with minimal side effects

definitions: making something as large or great as possible, increasing to the highest degree or amount
examples: The company focused on maximising profits through efficient operations
Their maximising strategy involved utilizing every available resource

definitions: making something as large or great as possible, increasing to the highest degree or amount
examples: The software uses maximizing algorithms to optimize storage space
She developed a maximizing approach to her study time

definitions: relating to the office, duties, or position of a mayor in city government
examples: The mayoral election attracted several qualified candidates this year
His mayoral duties included presiding over city council meetings

definitions: lacking in quantity or quality; scanty, inadequate, or barely sufficient for needs
examples: Their meager savings barely covered the emergency medical expenses
The refugees survived on meager rations of rice and water

definitions: lacking in quantity or quality; scanty, inadequate, or barely sufficient for needs
examples: The charity provided meagre meals to hundreds of homeless people
His meagre income forced him to work multiple part-time jobs

definitions: having a dry, powdery, or crumbly texture like meal or flour
pale, wan, or unhealthy-looking in color or complexion
examples: The overcooked potatoes had an unpleasant mealy texture
The old apples became mealy and lost their crisp bite
His mealy complexion suggested he rarely ventured into sunlight
The mealy appearance of the leaves indicated a fungal infection

definitions: following a winding or indirect course without a fixed direction or purpose
examples: The meandering river carved its way slowly through the valley
His meandering speech lost the audience's attention after ten minutes

definitions: having no meaning, purpose, or significance; devoid of sense or relevance
examples: The contract contained meaningless legal jargon that confused everyone
Without context, the ancient symbols appeared meaningless to archaeologists

definitions: able to be measured or quantified using specific units, standards, or instruments
examples: The new diet produced measurable improvements in cholesterol levels
Student progress must be assessed through measurable learning objectives

definitions: carefully considered and deliberate in speech or action, showing restraint and thoughtfulness
having a slow, regular rhythm or pace, often suggesting control or formality
examples: She gave a measured response to avoid escalating the conflict
His measured approach to investing protected him during market downturns
The guards marched with measured steps across the palace courtyard
She spoke in measured tones that commanded everyone's attention

definitions: containing a lot of meat or having the taste and texture of meat
full of substance, interest, or important content worth serious consideration
examples: The restaurant served meaty burgers that satisfied the hungriest customers
Vegetarians can enjoy meaty mushrooms as a protein substitute
The professor assigned a meaty article on constitutional law
The actor searched for meaty roles that would challenge his abilities

definitions: equipped with machinery or automatic devices to replace human or animal labor in production
examples: The mechanised farm could harvest acres of wheat in hours
Modern warfare relies heavily on mechanised infantry units

definitions: relating to theories that explain phenomena in purely physical or mechanical terms without considering purpose or meaning
examples: His mechanistic view of human behavior ignored emotional and spiritual factors
The mechanistic approach to biology treats organisms as complex machines

definitions: equipped with machinery or automatic devices to replace human or animal labor in production
examples: The mechanized assembly line increased production by three hundred percent
Mechanized logging equipment could clear forests with alarming speed

definitions: interfering in other people's affairs or business without being asked or wanted
examples: Her meddling mother-in-law constantly offered unwanted parenting advice
The meddling neighbor always had opinions about everyone's personal business

definitions: relating to the Middle Ages in European history, roughly from the 5th to 15th century
examples: The mediaeval castle stood on a hill overlooking the village
Students studied mediaeval manuscripts written by monks in Latin

definitions: situated in the middle or median position, especially in anatomy or linguistics
examples: The medial nerve runs through the center of the forearm
In the word 'butter', the double 't' is in medial position

definitions: denoting the middle value in a series of values arranged in order of size
situated in the middle, especially of the body or a structure
examples: The median household income provides a better measure than the average
Students calculated both mean and median scores for their data set
The median strip divided the highway into opposing traffic lanes
Surgeons made an incision along the median line of the abdomen

definitions: connected indirectly through something intervening rather than directly; not immediate
examples: The drug had mediate effects on blood pressure through hormone regulation
Their mediate relationship involved communication only through lawyers

definitions: brought about or transmitted through an intervening agency, mechanism, or medium rather than directly
examples: The allergic reaction was mediated by specific immune system cells
Their mediated communication through translators slowed down negotiations

definitions: having healing, curative, or therapeutic properties used in the treatment of disease or maintenance of health
examples: Many herbs in her garden had medicinal properties for common ailments
The medicinal taste of cough syrup made children reluctant to take it

definitions: relating to the Middle Ages in European history, roughly from the 5th to 15th century
resembling or suggesting the Middle Ages, especially in being primitive, outdated, or barbaric
examples: The medieval cathedral took over two hundred years to complete
Knights in medieval times followed a strict code of chivalry
The prison conditions were absolutely medieval by modern standards
His medieval attitudes about women's roles shocked his colleagues
